data.title: Famous Catalans in History
data.meta_description: List of the most famous Catalans in history, with famous, important and notable Catalans hand-picked by our team of editors and ranked by popularity.
data.text:
Famous Catalans

Home

Famous People

Nationality

Catalan

1. Carles Puigdemont

2. Antoni Gaudi

List of Catalan People

Francisco Manuel de Mello, Portuguese writer (Catalan Revolt), born in Lisbon, Portugal (d. 1666)

Joan Cererols, Catalan musician, composer and monk, born in Martorell (d. 1680)

Antonio Soler, Spanish Catalan composer (Fandango), born in Olot, Catalonia, Spain (d. 1783)

Ramon Vilanova y Barrera, Catalan composer and choirmaster, born in Barcelona, Spain (d. 1870)

Marià Obiols, Catalan composer, born in Barcelona (d. 1888)

Eugène Charles Catalan, French-Belgian mathematician (worked on continued fractions, descriptive geometry, number theory and combinatorics), born in Bruges, Belgium (d. 1894)

José Marraco y Ferrer, Catalan church musician and composer, born in Barcelona, Spain (d. 1913)

Antoni Gaudí, Catalan-Spanish architect (Sagrada Família, Casa Milà, Casa Batlló), born in Reus, Catalonia, Spain (d. 1926)

Alfredo Catalani, Italian operatic composer, born in Lucca, Grand Duchy of Tuscany (d. 1893)

Juan Lamote de Grignon, Catalan pianist, composer (La nit de Nadal (Christmas Night); Hespèria), and orchestra leader (Cobla Barcelona; València Municipal Orchestra), born in Barcelona, Spain (d. 1949)

Juli Garreta, Spanish-Catalan composer (Sardanes; Les illes Medes), born in Sant Feliu de Guíxols, Spain (d. 1925)

Joan Gamper, Swiss-Catalan businessman and founder of FC Barcelona, born in Winterthur, Switzerland (d. 1930)

Francisco Pujol, Catalan singer, choirmaster (Orfeó Català), composer, and musicologist, born in Barcelona, Spain (d. 1945)

Jaume Pahissa, Spanish-Catalan composer (Gala Placidia; Aurora de esperanza), and musicologist, born in Barcelona, Spain (d. 1969)

Eugenio d'Ors, Spanish Catalan essayist and philosopher, born in Barcelona, Spain (d. 1954)

Margarita Xirgu, Catalan stage actress, director and political radical (Bloody Wedding, Mariana Pineda), born in Barcelona, Spain (d. 1969)

Andreu Nin, Catalan politician (d. 1937)

Federico Mompou, Catalan composer (Música Callada -'The Voice of Silence'), born in Barcelona, Spain (d. 1987)

Eduardo Toldrà, Spanish Catalan composer and conductor, born in Vilanova i la Geltrú, Spain (d. 1962)

Roberto Gerhard, Spanish Catalan composer (the Plague), born in Valls, Catalonia, Spain (d. 1970)

Manuel Blancafort, Spanish-Catalan pianist and composer, born in La Garriga, Spain (d. 1987)

Lluís Maria Millet, Catalan composer, born in Barcelona, Spain (d. 1990)

Mercè Rodoreda, Catalan novelist (La plaça del diamant), born in Barcelona (d. 1983)

Victoria de los Ángeles, Catalan operatic lyric soprano, born in Barcelona, Spain (d. 2005)

Guy Williams [Armando Joseph Catalano], American actor (Zorro; Lost in Space), born in New York City (d. 1989)

Xavier Benguerel, Catalan composer (Llibre Vermell; Jo, Dalí), born in Barcelona, Spain (d. 2017)

Juan Guinjoan, Catalan composer and pianist, born in Riudoms, Spain (d. 2019)

Leonardo Balada, Catalan American composer, born in Barcelona, Spain

Jorge "Jordi" Cervelló, Catalan composer and musicologist, born in Barcelona, Spain

Montserrat Figueras, Catalan soprano and early music advocate (Hespèrion), born in Barcelona, Spain (d. 2011)

Carles Rexach, former Spanish-Catalan footballer and coach

Ettore Messina, Italian basketball coach (Olimpia Milano), born in Catalania, Italy

Carles Puigdemont [i Casamajó], Catalan politician and nationalist (President of Catalonia, 2016-17), born in Amer, Catalonia, Spain

Catalan History Timeline
